New Records: Yoshinobu Yamamoto and Yu Darvish faced off in the first Major League Baseball post-season match-up between two Japanese-born starting pitchers.
Key Match Events: Yoshinobu Yamamoto pitched five brilliant innings, giving up two hits, one walk, and two strikeouts.
Enrique Hernandez hit a solo home run in the second inning.
Teoscar Hernandez hit a 420-foot solo home run in the seventh inning.
The Dodgers' relievers closed out the game without allowing a hit over four innings.
Post-Match Reflections: The victory means Japanese superstar Shohei Ohtani will have a chance to battle for a World Series berth.
Ohtani is in the playoffs for the first time after joining the Dodgers in December in a record 10-year, $700 million deal.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers, the 2020 World Series champions, are back in the league championship series for the first time since 2021.
